candidates.platform:
Candidate Platform

Hey everyone, I’m Vlad!

This year, I would love to represent you as the IEEE uOttawa Branch Chair. Since I got elected into the branch last year, I instantly fell in love with the association and what it stands for. To me, IEEE means inclusion, acceptance, and collaborative innovation in the electrical engineering and computing community.

This past year, COVID challenged our uOttawa engineering community in a way that nobody expected. What was meant to be a two-week break from in-person school still hasn’t ended. Even so, we all worked together to keep our community strong. From creating massive Discord chats to hosting virtual events, virtual hangouts, and even creating virtual voting platforms, we used our innovation in a way that no other group of people could. And for that, I’m proud of every single engineer out there. Even the simple act of joining a group chat had a massive impact on preserving our solidarity.

The transition back to in-person learning provides us with a brand new set of challenges that we, as a group, have to face. It will force us to adapt to our ever-changing academic environment. With this period of transition comes a lot of uncertainty. 

Throughout this time of change, I plan to keep one thing consistent. Our collective community as engineering students. I will make sure that, even throughout this period, we maintain as much transparency as possible between the faculty and the students to make this time as stress-free as possible.

Among this, I plan on keeping our association at IEEE uOttawa a very beneficial and fun environment for anyone that wishes to participate. Here is a list of plans that I have for the next school year.

* Work with the faculty towards opening up our student office in a safe and responsible manner
* Host tech panels on leading edge technologies such as machine learning and blockchain with Ottawa’s leading professionals.
* Build an inclusive and inviting environment with the next team of VPs
* Create association-funded projects (e.g. build a community drone) to expose students to real-world hardware and software applications

I’m always available for any questions or comments at vjidk018@uottawa.ca . Everyone is always welcome to email me.

In all, I would love to help IEEE uOttawa as an association expand and innovate in our academic community. But I can’t do this without your vote. Help me bring these ideas to life! 

#Vote4Vlad

Hello, my name is Madison Smrtka and I will be going into my fourth year of ELG and I am running for the Vice-Chair position of our IEEE uOttawa branch. I have held an exec position on IEEE uOttawa for three years now, as VP Communication (2018), VP Social (2019) and Vice-Chair (2020) and would love to continue on next year in a more leadership role. I have would like to continue to use my position to better organise and inspire our team in order for us to continue to provide you with resources, support and fun social events with a focus on your specific needs during this unprecedented time.
----------
Salut, je m'appelle Madison Smrtka et je serais bien tôt dans ma quatrième année en génie électrique et je souhaite être votre vice-présidente de IEEE uOttawa. Durant les trois années précédentes, j'étais VP de communication (2018), VP d'affaires sociales (2019) et Vice-Chair (2020) et j'aimerais assumer un rôle avec plus de qualités de dirigeant. J'espère continuer d’utiliser ma position comme vice-présidente pour améliorer l'organisation et d'inspirer notre équipe pour que nous pourrions continuer d'assurer des ressources, d'appui et des soirées mondaines sur vos besoins spécifiques pendant cette période sans précédent.

My name is Mohit Kapur, and I am applying for the role of Vice-Chairperson for IEEE uOttawa. Over the last year working as the VP of social affairs, I gained a solid understanding of the organization. As the VP social, I was responsible for outreach within the team was well as the community. I feel having the experience of running events, ranging from a simple movie night to hosting a comedian allowed me to really experience the most out of IEEE so far. My goal in this position is to maintain the high level of coordination within as is already present and I believe my previous experience and understanding of the team will aid me in ensuring the new members are welcome, as well as maintaining the same chemistry with the returning members. Being the Vice-chair, I would be the right hand to the Chair, which is a responsibility I know I can be depended upon for. There will be a high level of transparency between myself and the community, allowing for easy outreach. Overall, this is an extremely promising role, and I cannot wait to experience another year being able to work with this community to help it grow.

------------------------------------------------

Je m’appelle Mohit Kapur et je postule pour la position de Vice-Président de l’IEEE uOttawa. Durant mon année dernière comme VP Social, j’ai gagné une connaissance très profonde sur l’organisation et son fonctionnement. Étant VP Social, j’étais responsable de la sensibilisation en sein de l’équipe, mais aussi en sein de la communauté d’étudiants. J’ai confiance qu’avoir de l’expérience d’organiser des événements, soit une simple soirée cinéma ou accueillir un comédien, m’a  permit de découvrir le plus sur l’IEEE jusqu’à ce moment. Mon but pour cette position est de maintenir le haut niveau de coordination comme si, et je crois fortement que mes expériences et connaissances passées vont m’aider à assurer que les nouveaux membres se sentent accueillis, en toute fois gardant une bonne dynamique entre eux et les membres de retour. Étant le Vice-Président, je serais la main gauche du Président ce qui est une responsabilité que je peux être assuré avec. Il y a aura un très haut niveau de transparence entre la communauté et moi-même, facilitant donc la sensibilisation. En général, ceci est une position extrêmement prometteuse et je suis ravi de vivre une autre année travaillant au sein de cette communauté, et l’aidant à continuer de se développer.

candidates.platform:
My name is Sanat Nayar and I am a third year student in Computer Engineering and I wish to be re-elected for Treasurer at IEEE at the University of Ottawa for the 2021/2022 year. 
      I have served as the Treasurer for IEEE UOttawa for the past 2 years and I have learned a lot about what the role entails. I have acquired knowledge relating to the audits, banking regulations, the square invoicing system and the budget making process. I believe the accumulation of experience from the past 2 years will help me become a better treasurer.

My goals for this next year:
-Assist in developing a long-term financial plan
-Invest in long-term, low-risk investments (ex. Guaranteed Investment Certificates (GICs)) for financial sustainability and to gain interest on cash sitting in the IEEE account.
-Help more efficiently manage company finances to support better and bigger events.
-Facilitate an incubation process with fellow executives to assist in ideation of effective events that are run with appropriate financing and benefit the students.

      Over the past 3 years, I have culminated a multitude of external experiences that would make me a perfect fit for this role at IEEE. I have been elected the VP of Finance for two student run businesses. In this role, I have learned not only the aspects of finance such as break-even analysis, balance sheets, and cash flow statements, but also how engineering and finance can be easily merged to manage an organization. In one of the student run companies called Swappable, the USP of the company was its platform for transfer of goods and services between students within my High School. Swappable gave me real-life experience on how engineering can be integrated with finance to create a successful product. It also gave me attributes such as money management and the ability to use effective cost-cutting strategies to increase the profits and reduce the liabilities of the company. I believe these experiences and the knowledge I gained from my mentors who initiated the student companies have helped me transition into the role as the treasurer at IEEE and will definitely help in the coming year. 
     IEEE is an association that plays an integral part in the Engineering ecosystem at UOttawa. It is a trustworthy organization that many students and staff lookup to for new information, events and competitions. In order for it to run efficiently, finances have to be managed properly and costs must be accounted for. Based on my past experiences and my passion to contribute to the IEEE platform, I believe I am the ideal candidate for this position. 

***** French:
Je m’appelle Sanat Nayar et je suis un étudiant de troisième année en ingénierie informatique et j’aimerais être réélu comme trésorier à l'IEEE à l'Université d'Ottawa pour l'année 2021/2022.
   	Au cours de l’année dernière, j'ai été trésorier de l'IEEE UOttawa et j'ai beaucoup appris sur ce qu'implique ce rôle. J'ai acquis des connaissances relatives aux audits, à la réglementation bancaire, au système de paiement Square et au processus budgétaire. Je crois que l'accumulation de mes expériences au cours de l’année dernière me feront un encore meilleur trésorier.

Mes objectifs pour l'année prochaine:

 -Investir dans des investissements à long terme et à risque faible (ex. Certificats de placement garanti (CPG)) pour la viabilité financière et pour gagner des intérêts sur l’argent restant dans le compte IEEE.
 -Aider à gérer les finances de l'entreprise plus efficacement pour parrainer des événements meilleurs et plus grands.
 -Faciliter un processus d'incubation avec les cadres pour aider à la idéation d'événements efficaces qui sont gérés avec un financement approprié et qui est avantageux pour les étudiants.

Au cours des 3 dernières années, j'ai culminé une multitude d'expériences externes qui me rendraient parfaitement adapté à ce rôle à l'IEEE. J'ai été élu vice-président des finances pour deux entreprises dirigées par des étudiants. Dans ce rôle, j'ai appris non seulement les aspects de la finance comme l'analyse de rentabilité, les bilans et les états des flux de trésorerie, mais aussi comment l'ingénierie et la finance peuvent être facilement mis ensemble pour gérer une organisation. Dans une des entreprises gérées par des étudiants appelée Swappable, l'USP de l'entreprise était sa plate-forme pour le transfert de biens et de services entre les étudiants de mon école secondaire. Swappable m'a donné une expérience réelle sur la façon comment l'ingénierie peut être intégrée avec la finance pour créer un produit génial. Cela m'a aussi donné des attributs tels que la gestion de l'argent et la capacité d'utiliser des stratégies de réduction des coûts pour augmenter les bénéfices et réduire les passifs de l'entreprise. Je crois que ces expériences et les connaissances que j'ai obtenus de mes mentors qui ont initié les entreprises étudiantes m'ont aidé à passer au poste de trésorier de l'IEEE et m'aideront certainement au cours de l'année à venir.
        L'IEEE est une association qui joue un rôle intégral dans l'écosystème du génie à l'Université d'Ottawa. Il est une organisation digne de confiance que de nombreux étudiants et membres du personnel consultent pour de nouvelles informations, des événements et des concours. Pour fonctionner efficacement, les finances doivent être gérées proprement et les coûts doivent être pris en compte. Sur la base de mes expériences passées et de ma passion pour contribuer à la plateforme IEEE, je crois que je suis le candidat idéal pour ce poste.

Name: Benjamin Flynn
Program: BAC in Software Engineering
Year of study: 2nd 

As a long-time admirer of the impressive work being done by the IEEE team, I am delighted to submit my application for treasurer. I am currently in my second-year of software engineering at uOttawa and being part of IEEE has been an interest of mine for quite some time now. In multiple of my previous work experiences, I have dealt with finances so what better position to apply for than treasurer. Thus, I am aware of the attention to detail and responsibilities associated with the position and I believe my skill set will be a great asset to the team. 

For example, I was responsible in my previous position for doing inventory and handling the money that was made every day.  This also included giving notes and predictions to the staff making the product on how much product to bring to the market. This process helped save a lot of money since we would barely waste any product. This experience will very much help with things like writing a projected budget at the beginning of the term or Completion and submission of account audit to the ESS.

I have greatly enjoyed my time at the University of Ottawa so far and with Covid - 19 turning everyone's life upside down including my own I have been looking for a way to get more involved with the school. Therefore, I very grateful for this opportunity.

Hi! I’m Rikki Romana (she/her), a second-year Electrical Engineering & Computing Technology student, and I am running for IEEE VP Academic! Since coming to university, I’ve been involved in ESS as the first-year representative, I’ve attended ESSCO conferences, and I’m currently the ESS electrical engineering representative for my cohort. 

Student academic support and advocacy have always been super important to me. During this COVID-19 pandemic, the quality of education has dramatically decreased, so I’m running for VP Academic because I want to help improve EECS students’ academic experience. I’ve been in constant communication with EECS students this year, so I know and understand the academic concerns and complaints from students to voice to the faculty. As VP Academic I will communicate with both students and faculty to ensure the quality of education.

Additionally, I’ve worked with ESSCO this year, where I helped research equity, diversity, inclusivity and academic/mental health resources in Ontario Engineering institutions. Through this research, we found that engineering students believe that the academic resources offered at their school are not very accessible. I’ve also learned that the engineering student body is very diverse, and many students are neurodivergent and have mental illness/health issues. As VP Academic, my focus is to make the academic resources more accessible to EECS students virtually and at the McNaughton Centre. I also aim to create more academic and mental health resources for underrepresented groups and people who are neurodivergent/have a mental illness to help promote equity, diversity, and inclusivity in our Faculty.

Finally, I believe in the importance of encouraging learning outside of the classroom. As VP Academic, I aim to organize academic events and workshops that will help students expand their skills. I also aim to help improve IEEE’s Cookies and Cram study sessions and make the study resources more available to students.

Why am I the ideal candidate for this position?
•	I’ve been involved with student politics since high school and have been part of the ESS Board of Directors since my first year, so I’m very comfortable with attending meetings, and I know how to effectively represent and reach out to students.
•	I’m a Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador. In this role, I’ve gained experience running workshops for students!
•	I’m a very passionate person, and I will be fully committed to the VP Academic role.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Salut! Je m’appelle Rikki Romana (elle / lui), une étudiante de deuxième année en ELG et CTI, et je suis candidat à l'IEEE VP Academic! Depuis mon arrivée à l’université, j’ai été impliqué dans l’AÉG en tant que représentant de première année, j’ai assisté à des conférences CAÉGO et je suis actuellement le représentant AÉG de mon cohorte en génie électrique.

Le soutien scolaire et le plaidoyer des étudiants ont toujours été très importants pour moi. Au cours de cette pandémie de COVID-19, la qualité de l’éducation a considérablement diminué, je me présente donc à titre de vice-président académique parce que je veux aider à améliorer l’expérience académique des étudiants EECS. J'ai été en communication constante avec les étudiants de l'EECS cette année, donc je connais et comprends les préoccupations académiques et les plaintes des étudiants pour faire entendre leur voix à la Faculté. En tant que vice-président académique, je communiquerai avec les étudiants et les professeurs pour assurer la qualité de l'éducation.

De plus, j’ai travaillé avec CAÉGO cette année, où j’ai contribué à la recherche sur l’équité, la diversité, l’inclusion et les ressources universitaires / en santé mentale dans les établissements d’ingénierie de l’Ontario. Grâce à cette recherche, nous avons constaté que les étudiants en génie estiment que les ressources académiques offertes dans leur école ne sont pas très accessibles. J'ai également appris que le corps des étudiants en génie est très diversifié et que de nombreux étudiants sont neurodivergents et ont des problèmes de santé / maladie mentale. En tant que vice-président aux études, mon objectif est de rendre les ressources académiques plus accessibles virtuellement aux étudiants de l'EECS et au McNaughton Center. Je vise également à créer plus de ressources universitaires et en santé mentale pour les groupes sous-représentés et les personnes neurodivergentes / atteintes de maladie mentale afin de contribuer à promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans notre faculté.

Enfin, je crois en l'importance d'encourager l'apprentissage en dehors de la salle de classe. En tant que vice-président académique, je vise à organiser des événements académiques et des ateliers qui aideront les étudiants à développer leurs compétences. Je vise également à aider à améliorer les sessions d’étude sur les « Cookies and Cram » de l’IEEE et à rendre les ressources d’étude plus accessibles aux étudiants.

Pourquoi suis-je le candidat idéal pour ce poste?

	• Je suis impliqué dans la politique étudiante depuis le lycée et je fais partie du conseil d’administration de l’AÉG depuis ma première année. Je suis donc très à l’aise pour assister à des réunions, et je sais comment représenter et toucher efficacement les étudiants.
	• Je suis un « Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador ». Dans ce rôle, j’ai acquis de l’expérience en organisant des ateliers pour les étudiants!
	• Je suis une personne très passionnée et je serai pleinement engagé dans le rôle de vice-président académique.

Hello! I’m Pavly Saleh. I am running to be your IEEE VP Communications. I believe that I am the ideal candidate for this position. Communication is everything. Being able to communicate effectively is an essential skill. As a trilingual student myself, I am able to efficiently communicate with the English and French-speaking students, as well as those who speak Arabic! 
As VP Communications, it will be my duty to announce and promote all events organized by IEEE. I take this role with great honour, as seeing our EECS students getting more involved in events and growing in number makes me very proud to be part of this community. While I am inexperienced with being a member of IEEE, I know I will be a valuable addition to the team as I will always thrive to bring constant upbeat energy, along with new ideas. 
So far, the IEEE have done a wonderful job of communicating to students and members the services they offer. My goal is to continue and to expand upon this in order to ensure all announcements are clearly delivered to students. The IEEE offers various services, scholarships, and events! Making sure students are aware of these benefits is my main priority. As VP Communications, I would ensure transparency, and the collaboration in meaningful events for students.
In the words of the great Nelson Mandela, “If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his own language, that goes to his heart”. I cannot wait to work with you this year as VP Communications! I’m looking forward to communicating with you!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Salut! Je suis Pavly Saleh. Je pose ma candidature pour le poste de IEEE VP Communications. Je suis le candidat idéal pour ce poste. La communication est la clé du succès. Être capable de communiquer avec clarté est une compétence essentielle. Étant moi-même un étudiant trilingue, je suis capable de communiquer efficacement avec les étudiants anglophones et francophones, ainsi qu’en arabe! 
En tant que VP Communications, il sera de mon devoir d'annoncer et de promouvoir tous les événements organisés par l'IEEE. J'assume ce rôle avec grand honneur, car voir nos étudiants de SIGE s'impliquer davantage me rend très fier de faire partie de cette communauté. Bien que je manque d’expérience en tant que membre de l'IEEE, je suis certain que je serai un ajout précieux à l'équipe car je m'épanouirai toujours pour remplir mes fonctions avec énergie et enthousiasme, ainsi qu’introduire des nouvelles idées.

Comme VP Communications, je vais prioriser la transparence, ainsi que la collaboration lors d’événements dédiés aux étudiants.
Dans les paroles de Nelson Mandela, «Si vous parlez à un homme dans une langue qu’il comprend, vous parlez à sa tête. Si vous lui parlez dans sa langue, vous parlez à son cœur». Je me réjouis de travailler avec vous cette année en tant que VP Communications! J'ai hâte de communiquer avec vous!

My name is Alex Vandici. I am a third-year electrical engineering and computing technology student, and I am running for McNaughton Centre Director. 

In the past, I have worked as an Electrical Test Technologist doing quality control and root cause analysis on custom transformers and Inductors in the aerospace sector. I also have experience working with IEEE Ottawa as the Technical Director for Battle Royale 13. I plan to achieve the following:

•	Schedule training events to teach students the correct usage of equipment inside the McNaughton Centre.

•	Advocate for additional industry-standard equipment to be added to the lab, while also applying for grants.

During my time as a Test Technologist, I had the opportunity to learn how to use a variety of testing equipment including, but not limited to, source generators, impedance analyzers, LCR bridges, signal generators, dielectric test sets, and corona discharge tests using high voltage equipment. 

Because of my past experience working inside of an aerospace testing environment and working with IEEE Ottawa, I am confident in my ability to uphold the lab standards inside of the McNaughton Centre and to create an environment of learning.

Alex

My name is Khaled Atia. I am a PhD student at the University of Ottawa under the supervision of Prof. Hanan Anis. My PhD focuses on Integrated optics for Raman spectrometer. I am writing to express my strong motivation to join the IEEE uOttawa community as photonics-chair. 
I am in my third year of my PhD in Electrical Engineering. I joined the University of Ottawa as a visiting researcher in the period 2017-2018, after I finished my master’s degree in time domain modelling of photonic devices from Mansour University, Egypt.
Throughout my research in photonics, I managed to publish 7 articles in prestigious journals, participated in 5 international conferences and published a book chapter. 
As soon as I joined the University of Ottawa, I became an active member in the uOttawa photonics society by helping in planning and organizing photonics related events. I joined the OSA and SPIE uOttawa society to help promoting photonics at the University of Ottawa Community. Throughout my one year of work with the OSA/SPIE photonics chapter, I acquired excellent experience in organizing workshops, events, and social activities. I am currently holding an officer position in the University of Ottawa OSA/SPIE joint chapter. I helped establishing the uOttawa photonics journal club.
I feel as a graduate photonics student that I am responsible for draw the attention of undergraduate student to photonics as a career and to shed the light on the promising future of this field. I believe my experience will help me to achieve that with the right chance.  
Becoming an IEEE executive will provide me with the excellent opportunity to prompt photonics between undergraduate engineers and physicists.  to be part of a dynamic and exciting work force while learning and collaborating with your outstanding team members.
